Text: Appreciate these uploads, James. Have you given any thought to 720p > 480p? I know the file size will go up by about 60%, however. Also, to help with this, you could bump the audio down to 96 kbit or 80 kbit. I know 720p is more difficult to manage, so if you can't it's not a big deal at all. Things are just more pretty in 720p is all. :)
Also, how are you getting 29.97 FPS on all your encodes? Shouldn't most of them be 23.976 FPS (unless they're PAL sources)?

at tech9 sorry my internet is so slow will be finished seeding in a few more hours.

at jmac 29.97 is basically half rate of what the broadcast is 59.97 FPS.   And seeing as the cars are going 200 mph if I do 23.97 or 24 it doesn't look as good.
it not the full race you start uploading after 70 laps of the race nooooooooo!!!!!!!!

@James: I see. I was just curious is all, as I see -every- other American show at 23.976, so it seemed odd. I also asked about 720p...but you did say your internet was slow, so that wouldn't help on the seeding front.
Thanks again!  I am one of your biggest fans.  Since I can't get these races here in Thailand, I am very grateful you are supplying them.
One more thing, I vote for high def as opposed to smaller file size.  I can live with longer download times just fine.
